intro: Aeschynanthus linearifolius var. angustissimus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf gloxinia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and clusters of tubular, brightly colored flowers that range from red to orange. The plant is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Its unique floral structure makes it a popular choice for indoor gardening and botanical collections.
